text: Patient characteristics (age, gender, weight, body mass index, Table 1) . The most frequent surgical procedure in both groups was femoral osteotomy (75%), followed by pelvic osteotomy (46%) (Table 2). Although there was a trend of faster emergence from anesthesia in the fentanyl group, it was not statistically significant (p=0.055). There was also no difference in duration of PACU stay between the two groups.
sentences: Patient characteristics (age, gender, weight, body mass index, Table 1) .
The most frequent surgical procedure in both groups was femoral osteotomy (75%), followed by pelvic osteotomy (46%) (Table 2).
Although there was a trend of faster emergence from anesthesia in the fentanyl group, it was not statistically significant (p=0.055).
There was also no difference in duration of PACU stay between the two groups.
